description: From Latin concīsus (“cut short”), from concīdere (“cut to pieces”), from caedēre (“to cut, to strike down”).

adjectives.description: concise (comparative more concise, superlative most concise)

entries.meaning: Brief, yet including all important information
examples: Synonyms: succinct, terse; see also Thesaurus:concise

verbs.description: concise (third-person singular simple present concises, present participle concising, simple past and past participle concised)

entries.meaning: (India, transitive) To make concise; to abridge or summarize.
